description:
The Olympic Regional Development Authority (Olympic Authority) is seeking a strategic visionary with established leadership skills to be its Vice President of Marketing, Communications, and Sponsorship. The successful candidate will be an integral member of the Olympic Authority’s Senior Leadership Team and will be responsible for defining and executing effective strategies for the Olympic Authority’s business development activities and their ensuring alignment with the Olympic Authority’s broader vision and direction.

The Olympic Authority is a New York State public benefit corporation created in 1981 to manage, operate, and maintain the venues used during the 1932 and 1980 Lake Placid Winter Olympic Games. Today the Olympic Authority administers state-of-the-art venues in the Catskill and Adirondack Mountains of New York. ORDA strategically manages its venues to provide year-round recreational opportunities for the public, as well as training and events for all levels of athletes.

The Vice President of Marketing, Communications, and Sponsorship works out of the Olympic Authority’s Administrative Office Building in Lake Placid, New York, and is ultimately responsible and accountable for the development and execution of comprehensive marketing, sponsorship, communications, and sales strategies for the Olympic Authority. Reporting directly to the President and Chief Executive Officer, the VP of Marketing, Sponsorship, and Communications provides oversight and leadership to the organization’s corporate revenue-generating departments, and the organization’s communications staff, whose responsibilities include working closely with all departments’ messaging about Olympic Authority operations.

Daily activities required to complete job assignments include standing or being seated for extended periods. Work outside the normal workday will be required as is necessary to fulfill job responsibilities and/or meet critical deadlines. Travel may be required to fulfill responsibilities.

Essential Duties (this list is not exhaustive):

Ø Provide leadership, coordination and alignment of the Marketing, Communications, and Sponsorship teams

Ø Work with the Director of Marketing to develop and execute integrated marketing plans to promote the Olympic Authority’s venues, events, and programs

Ø Work with the Director of Communications to develop and implement a comprehensive communication strategy to engage various stakeholders including athletes, the public, media, government officials, and staff

Ø Work with the Director of Marketing and Sponsorship Coordinator to develop new and expand current relationships with corporate sponsors, partners, and stakeholders that align with the Olympic Authority brand to secure financial support and in-kind contributions

Ø Work with venue General Managers to develop cohesive organization and communication between venue marketing teams and Olympic Authority Administration;

Ø Oversee the development and maintenance of strong and consistent brand identity and brand delivery for the Olympic Authority

Ø Regularly represent the Olympic Authority at public events, government meetings, media opportunities, and community functions

Ø Oversee the development of proactive messaging regarding operations, events, marketing and sales, Board meetings, and other Olympic Authority activities as well as the timely development and distribution of responses to press and other media inquiries about the Olympic Authority

Ø Instill and maintain a strong focus on budgets, goals, and achievements for the marketing, sales, and communications teams

Ø Collaborate with the Senior Leadership Team on short and long-term strategies through regular reporting on progress against the marketing, communications and sponsorships plans including risks, and support required

Core Attributes:

Ø Creative, data-driven visionary

Ø Established leadership skills with strong perspectives on strategy and operations

Ø High standard of integrity and ethics

Ø Result driven and proven ability to execute

Ø Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ø Ability to guide and coach across all levels of a team

Ø Ability to provide direction and course correction inputs at all times

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Tourism, Hospitality, Business, Marketing or related field along with 10 years of experience in marketing, sponsorship, communications, and/or sales within a sport, entertainment, or related field. Five years’ experience leading or managing staff and/or teams in any of the fields identified above also required. Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and demonstrated success in negotiating and securing sponsorships/partnerships. Ability to think strategically, drive innovation, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment is key.

Other Considerations:

Master’s degree in Business Administration preferred, as is relevant experience in the public sector.

Compensation and Benefits:

This position is classified as a Grade 32 on the Olympic Authority’s Management Confidential Salary Schedule which has a minimum salary of $109,712 and a maximum salary of $175,539 per year. The hiring range for this specific position is $140,000 - $150,000 per year. Final offer will be within the hiring range and will be dependent on qualifications and experience.

The Olympic Authority offers an excellent benefits package that includes paid leave (paid parental, sick, vacation, and personal time); paid holidays; health, dental, and vision insurances; long term disability and supplemental life insurance at preferred rates; participation in the NYS and Local Retirement Systems; and optional participation in NYS Deferred Compensation.

Any offer of employment will be contingent upon the completion of a successful background check in accordance with the Olympic Authority’s Background Check Policy:

https://orda.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/7/2023/09/Background-Check-Policy.Final-Revised.September-22-2023.pdfBackground checks will be conducted by a Third-Party Administrator of the Olympic Authority’s choosing in compliance with the requirements of the New York State Fair Credit Reporting Act (General Business Law § 380) and the Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. § 1681).

The Olympic Authority is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer

Pursuant to Executive Order 161, no State entity is permitted to ask or to mandate, in any form, that an applicant for employment provide either their current compensation or any prior compensation history, until such time as the applicant is extended a conditional offer of employment with compensation. If any such information has been requested before the appropriate time, you may contact the Office of Employee Relations at (518) 474-6988

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Employee assistance program
• Employee discount
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Parental leave
• Retirement plan
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Holidays
• Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person
